body.plain:
Hey,

you might have heard of Docker [1].
I like to get your opinion this.

Background:
I thought about creating Docker containers with automated builds for some
MetricsGrimoire tools.
They can be use for development or testing purpose.

To be able to automate the builds (and be up to date at new releases) a
connection between DockerHub and the MetricsGrimoire Github Organisation
would make sense. But my rights are not enough at this.
That is the reason for this mail.

[1] https://www.docker.com/
-------------- next part --------------
An HTML attachment was scrubbed...
URL: <http://lists.libresoft.es/pipermail/metrics-grimoire/attachments/20151114/35d7c818/attachment.htm>

This is cool, Andy.

Which rights do you need?

	Jesus

http://twitter.com/jgbarah????????? http://gsyc.es/~jgb

If you are fine with it i would create an Organisation on Dockerhub with
the MetricsGrimoire name and invite you (or who?).
After this i will start building it and contribute the Dockerfile to the
projects and enable an automatic build (because we won`t do it manually ;)).

If i will need grants i will ping you again. Fine with it?

data.Subject:
[Metrics-grimoire] MLStats may change the semantic of --force any
	time soon

body.plain:
Hi,

For those of you who rely in the option --force to download everything
and anything available from web directories, I pushed some changes you
may be interested in.

In the future --force may mean to download again if the archive was
already downloaded (or broken and whatnot).

If you want to download web directories, you may want to use:

$ mlstats --backend=webdirectory ...

Thus, in the future, you won't get surprise if --force changes. The
details are here:
https://github.com/MetricsGrimoire/MailingListStats/issues/35

-- 
Germ?n Poo-Caama?o
http://calcifer.org/

Hi all,

This is to present GrimoreLab [1] to this mailing list. GrimoireLab is
intended to become a full platform for software development analytics,
from data retrieval to visualization. It is a complete redesign,
starting from scratch, of everything in MetricsGrimoire a vizGrimoire.?

After the experience of many years with *Grimoire, the idea is to write
more efficient, more flexible, more integrated and more capable tools.
For now, Bitergia is leading the developing effort, since it intends to
use GrimoireLab for its business, but anyone is welcome to join the
effort (including, of course, all of you).

If you don't mind, we intend to use this mailing list (with the tag
[GrimoireLab] in the subject, as in this message) to discuss about this
new system.

If you're interested in some more details, have a look at the
presentation I delivered recently at the Collab Summit [2].

Comments are welcome.

Saludos,

	Jesus.

[1]?http://grimoirelab.github.io/

[2]?https://speakerdeck.com/jgbarah/grimoirelab-a-tool-for-open-develop
ment-analytics

-- 
http://twitter.com/jgbarah????????? http://gsyc.es/~jgb

Thank you Jesus.
For me it is fine to use this mailinglist.

One question: The old tools (CVSAnaly, MLStats, ...) are deprecated /
obsolete and get no further development from your side anymore?

Andy

On Sat, 2016-04-23 at 18:18 +0200, Andy Grunwald wrote:
> Thank you Jesus.
> For me it is fine to use this mailinglist.

Great.

> One question: The old tools (CVSAnaly, MLStats, ...) are deprecated /
> obsolete and get no further development from your side anymore?

At least for a while, we're planning to still maintain them. For now,
we're still using them, and basing some services on them. But with
time, the new tools should provide all their functionality, and likely
Bitergia will no longer actively maintain them. Which doesn't mean that
some of their developers (be them hired by Bitergia or not) still
maintain them in their own time.

Saludos,

	Jesus.

> Andy
>
